pullRequest.body:
+ Define the universal Weierstrass curve (`Universal.curve`) over the polynomial ring `‚Ñ§[A‚ÇÅ,A‚ÇÇ,A‚ÇÉ,A‚ÇÑ,A‚ÇÜ]`, and the universal pointed elliptic curve (`Universal.pointedCurve`) over the field of fractions (`Universal.Field`) of the universal ring `‚Ñ§[A‚ÇÅ,A‚ÇÇ,A‚ÇÉ,A‚ÇÑ,A‚ÇÜ,X,Y]/‚ü®P‚ü© = Universal.Poly/‚ü®P‚ü©` (`Universal.Ring`, where `P` is the Weierstrass polynomial) with distinguished point `(X,Y)`.

+ Given a Weierstrass curve `W` over a commutative ring `R`, we define the specialization homomorphism `W.specialize : ‚Ñ§[A‚ÇÅ,A‚ÇÇ,A‚ÇÉ,A‚ÇÑ,A‚ÇÜ] ‚Üí+* R`. If `(x,y)` is a point on the affine plane, we define `W.polyEval x y : Universal.Poly ‚Üí+* R`, which factors through `W.ringEval x y : Universal.Ring ‚Üí+* R` if `(x,y)` is on `W`.

+ Introduce the cusp curve `Y¬≤ = X¬≥`, on which lies the rational point `(1,1)`, with the nice property that `œà‚Çô(1,1) = n`, making it easy to prove nonvanishing of the universal `œà‚Çô` when `n ‚â† 0` by specializing to the cusp curve, which shows that `(X,Y)` is a point of infinite order on the universal pointed elliptic curve.

---

- [x] depends on: #13845
- [x] depends on: #12883

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

#### Import changes

---

<details><summary>

`+ instance [Subsingleton R] : Subsingleton W.CoordinateRing`
`+ map`
`+ map_injective`
`+ map_mk`

`+ pointedCurve_a‚ÇÜ`

`+ polyEval_comp_eq_specialize`

`- baseChange_eval_polynomialY`
`- instAlgebraCoordinateRing`
`- instAlgebraCoordinateRing'`
`- instIsDomainCoordinateRing`
`- instIsDomainCoordinateRing_of_Field`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>

Thanks! I think I said somewhere (but I've lost it!) that I intend to combine stuff from this file with all the stuff to do with the coordinate ring, because I would think that these are "universal constructions" for any Weierstrass curve. I haven't had the time to do it so far, but can you give me some time to think about it? I'll make a subbranch (hopefully I don't mess it up again!).

> Thanks! I think I said somewhere (but I've lost it!) that I intend to combine stuff from this file with all the stuff to do with the coordinate ring, because I would think that these are "universal constructions" for any Weierstrass curve. I haven't had the time to do it so far, but can you give me some time to think about it? I'll make a subbranch (hopefully I don't mess it up again!).

I think you said it [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13399#issuecomment-2163491010). Yes I agree that for a Weierstrass curve W over comm. ring R you can define a "universal" Weierstrass curve over the coordinate ring R[W] with a distinguished point (X,Y) on it, such that every point (x,y) on W is the specialization of the distinguished point under the ring homomorphism R[W]->R sending X to x and Y to y. As I remarked [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/3d6da3dc779ad9a87bb94300bdc06f793e122d4e/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/DivisionPolynomial/ZSMul.lean#L68-L72), you can almost prove the ZSMul formula using this less universal ring, but it would not be so easy to show œà‚Çô ‚â† 0 when n ‚â† 0 if the characteristic divides n, and in char 2 there's an additional issue.

I'll try to refactor my code with generalized definitions, thanks for mentioning this!

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#13845~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12883~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

source.title: feat(EllipticCurve): ZSMul formula in terms of division polynomials
